body.p: Which of the following is not true of active transport processes?

multiple_choice.choice: It requires a protein carrier and enzymes.
It moves substances across membranes with their concentration gradients (downhill).
One example is the N+/K+ pump and active transport moves K+ into the cell.
None of the above are true of active transport processes.

feedback.p: Incorrect. It does require a protein carrier and enzymes but also requires ATP. Remember it is active transport so it is an active not a passive process.
Correct. Passive processes move molecules downhill, but active processes require energy to move the molecules. It takes energy to move an object uphill or against its concentration gradient.
Incorrect. It is true that the Na+/K+ pump is an example of active transport and K+ is moved against its concentration gradient and pumped back into the cell it escaped from.

Incorrect. Active transport requires 3 things: protein carriers, enzymes, and ATP and moves molecules against their gradients or uphill. In the cell this means it moves K+ from an area of low to high or pumps it back into the cell it escaped from.

hint.p: Active transport of the Na+/K+ pump requires energy and 2 other components to work properly.
